caption: Great food, great service, great atmosphere. It reminded me of why I love dining in New York. Took my wife and we held hands the whole night. Would give 6 out of 5 if I could.
Great atmosphere! We picked La Bernadean for a special occasion and had some excellent cocktails and fettuccini a la kale parmigiana. Will definitely come again.
Best night of my life!!! Very romantic food and atmosphere. When the waiter brought over dessert (deconstructed ice cream scoop) my partner pulled out a ring!!! Happily engaged and happily full :)
One of the best spots in Crown Heights!!

Chose this place on a whim after flying in from LA. Couldn't believe when I heard about a Thai-Armenian-Latin fusion place. LA is all about Thai, Armenian and Latin food so I had to check it out.  First of all, the atmosphere... Really cozy, warm and eccentric. I wish they didn't light Sandalwood scented candles on the tables, because I couldn't truly enjoy the smells of the spices filling the room.  The chef/busboy/waiter strip show was really entertaining. I imagine you would not find anything like this in the area. His yellow banana print boxers help distract you from the sweat dripping off his brow, onto the food.  The food was unbelievable. I've never seen a chef use fresh, local ingredients in such new and exciting ways as Chef Julius. The plating was impeccable, with every bit of food accenting the last. They clearly put a lot of thought into the construction of their dishes, and I have to commend them on their success.  In all, this experience was unforgettable. I will probably never be back, but I will tell everyone about it and I imagine there will be a long successful road for the owners of this establishment.

My wife and I were visiting from the great state of Texas. Yeehaw, this food was so dang good. I'm fixin' to get me some more when we fly back in. The surprise at the end of the meal was worth the wait, true Austin atmosphere.
Good food! Service was okay but they seemed busy.

After reading Chuck Hurlbut's rave review of La BernaDean in Hamhock Monthly, I knew I had to visit with my fiance. She was especially excited, as Hurlbut's description of the Gargantuan Fettuccine Alfredo with Spilled Bacon sounded spectacular, if not a once-in-a-lifetime experience.  Now, the food was breathtaking—I might even use the word euphoric. And the space is quaint, intimate, and rustic. It was obvious that the owners put a great deal of attention into this restaurant. But the service was peculiar.  There was only one employee on staff, acting as the maître d, server, chef and busboy. I understand it is a small space, and a relatively new restaurant, but this man was soaked with sweat from running about. He was dressed impeccably when we first arrived in the restaurant, but he continued taking more and more clothes off as he scurried about. As another reviewer stated he was wearing only boxers, glasses and an apron by the time he arrived with our starters. He looked like a moist honey baked ham that had been dropped into a pile of discarded dog fur. Another customer said it enhanced their dining experience, having whet their palate in between dishes, so I can't complain too much.  Otherwise, the experience was quite wonderful. I was confused when I asked for a post-dinner mint, as this man bent over and spoke from his buttocks as if he was Ace Ventura,  but again, I suppose this makes for a quirky dining experience. I can see why people keep coming back for more.

Stopped here while on a trip to the city and was very impressed with the food and service. It’s a small space and we could hear the chef singing to himself from the kitchen, but it all added to the quaint charm. Food was also fantastic. I’ve had a lot of Turducken in my day, but that one took the cake!
Don’t let the scaffolding scare you. Le BernaDean will wine and dine you with a chef’s table experience. Be sure to ask about the specials—you never know what they have up their sleeve!

The rustic atmosphere was a perfect companion to the farm-to-table dining experience. La BernaDean is a little high for my price range, so it's ideal for special occasions—like when my partner bemoans another evening of ordering pad thai and watching Battlestar Galactica. My only gripe is that spacing is small, and as I learned the hard way, you won't get seating for hours without a reservation. I highly recommend the homemade spam carbonara, it's better than it sounds!

Wonderful service! I came in on a busy Friday night and the owners graciously allowed me to bring my pet ferrets and kiss them on the mouth. They are the burden of my life. Come for the fresh and delicious tilapia!
When my husband suggested this place for our anniversary dinner, I was skeptical but was pleasantly surprised! Cozy, romantic atmosphere and great food. Would def recommend for date night!

Great cooking. Menu frequently changes. Chef Julius incorporates the freshest ingredients mixed with spunk to create unique flavors when he isn’t neck deep in soy sauce. Still confused why the chef was wearing only boxers, glasses, and an apron when the whole restaurant could see into the kitchen....

Best wine glasses in town. Can’t miss the semi-public outdoor space in the back. Don’t let the ever-changing mood lighting drive you away when it settles on red because this is hands-down the best Armenian-Thai-Latin fusion I’ve ever tasted.

Great food! (I never thought Thai-Latin-Armenian fusion would work, but I stand corrected) Not a lot of seating, but cozy atmosphere once you can get a table. The service is not great, tho. At times it seemed like the only person working was this one older guy who was very nice, but very slow. Service aside, I definitely recommend the Chipotle lamb pad thai!
BEST PAD SE EW IN NEW YORK CITY, PERIOD!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! (not dog friendly tho)

Overall great experience! Good ambience, very nice decor, and a great patio space. The food was very good and well worth the price and the wait. They have soups galore and a great selection of whiskey.
AWFUL service I spent two hours waiting for food and it never arrived
